verses.roman:
vaṁśī-vādye gopī-gaṇera vane ākarṣaṇa
tāṅ-sabāra saṅge yaiche vana-viharaṇa

synonyms: vaṁśī-vādye—on hearing the sound of the flute; gopī-gaṇera—of all the gopīs; vane—in the forest; ākarṣaṇa—the attraction; tāṅ-sabāra—of all of them; saṅge—in the company; yaiche—in what way; vana—in the forest; viharaṇa—wandering.
translation: Śrīvāsa Ṭhākura extensively explained how the gopīs were attracted to the forests of Vṛndāvana by the vibration of Kṛṣṇa's flute and how they wandered together in the forest.
